modules.description: The module offers hash computation and HMAC authentication functionalities, enabling operations on byte sequences, strings, and bigstrings through incremental updates or direct processing. It includes tools for generating and converting cryptographic digests, as well as comparing and formatting HMAC values. Use cases include securing data integrity, authenticating messages, and handling structured data transformations with specialized input formats.

Generates and verifies key derivation functions using the HKDF algorithm, supporting extract-and-expand phases with specified salt and info parameters. Operates on byte sequences and cryptographic contexts provided by nocrypto. Validates implementations against RFC test vectors for interoperability and correctness.

Extracts a pseudorandom key from input key material and an optional salt, then expands it into output keying material using a context-specific info string and desired length. Operates on byte strings to produce cryptographic keys suitable for symmetric encryption or authentication. Used in protocols requiring key derivation from shared secrets, such as establishing session keys in TLS 1.3.
